intro.p: Following recent crackdowns on password sharing, a major streaming service wants to understand how widespread the issue still is despite their new policies. According to their last official report, they estimate {{p0dec}}\% of their users share passwords outside their household. A tech journalist questions this figure and decides to conduct their own independent study.
They collect a random sample of {{s}} users. In the sample {{x}} users reported that they still share their passwords with people outside their household.

Compute the confidence interval for the sample at a {{CL}}\% confidence level (\alpha = {{alpha}}) and provide all your computations. You may use an app to do the computations. Provide a screenshot of any app you use and all computation you do. Use your confidence interval to answer the follow:

content.p: What is \hat{p}? Please give your answer exact to four decimal places.
What is the standard error for this interval? Please give your answer exact to four decimal places.
What is the confidence interval? Please give your answer in proper interval format exact to four decimal places.
Put your interval into the context of the scenario.

outtro.p: We can say with {{CL}}\% confidence, that between {{LB_p}}\% and {{UB_p}}\% of users are still sharing their passwords outside of their households.

intro.p: The journalist claims the true password-sharing rate is NOT {{p0dec}}\%. Do a hypothesis test using the same sample and confidence level from Part A. You may use an app to do the test. If you do so, you must insert a screenshot of your work and also specifically identify the following:

content.p: What are your null and alternative hypotheses? Be sure to use appropriate notation and justify your choice of the alternative hypothesis from the context of the problem.
What is the p-value of your test?
What is the conclusion of your hypothesis test? Include statistical justification for your conclusion.
Does the hypothesis test support the claim of the journalist? Why or why not?
Compare the results from the confidence interval and the hypothesis test
Are your results from your confidence interval and your hypothesis test consistent? In other words, do both types of inference tests support the same conclusion? Explain why or why not.
